Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack.synopsis: Lorin has been ordered to stay in the corner by the hag. The player has forced him out, and he is absolutely panicking - he knows the hag will punish him. He calls out, begging for forgiveness before clutching his heart as he experiences a massive heart attack and collapses on the floor - dead.

Victim_003_PAD_HeartAttack.synopsis: The Player has forced Lorin, the prescient victim, out of his corner in the hag lair. He begs Ethel for mercy, then clutches his chest as he dies of a heart attack - punishment for leaving his post.

Victim_001_AD_Dying.synopsis: Edgecase for if you don't speak to the victim and he has to die. You're about to puke your guts up after being de-petrified

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The two sessions 'Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack' and 'Victim_003_PAD_HeartAttack' both deal with Lorin suffering a fatal heart attack after being forced from his corner in the hag's lair. Their synopses indicate two variations of the same event (one where Lorin begs for forgiveness from the hag, and another where he begs Ethel for mercy). Thus, they represent mutually exclusive outcomes for the same scenario. The other session 'Victim_001_AD_Dying' appears to be an alternate consequence (an edge-case) when the player does not speak to the victim, and 'Rudder' provides no information tying it to any order or alternative conditions. Consequently, no ordering constraints can be determined among these sessions, other than the noted mutually exclusive pair.

Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack_0.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack_0.text: No, Ethel! I'm sorry! I'll go back! Argh.

Victim_003_PAD_HeartAttack_0.speaker: Player
Victim_003_PAD_HeartAttack_0.text: The hag's doing. It has to be.

Victim_001_AD_Dying_0.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_AD_Dying_0.text: The Bite! No. I don't want to die. I don't - Argh.
Victim_001_AD_Dying_0.context: NodeContext: You're about to puke your guts up and die a horrible death. You feel it coming - you're panicked, scared and terrified.
